Review Text:
Some interesting photos on the wall about the locality and key figures. One includes a photo of The Benjamin Satchwell Wetherspoons in Leamington Spa.
I waited over 5 minutes to be served despite only one customer being served. The server said her key had froze. Not sure why another member of staff couldn't serve me.
Eventually, I got my Shipyard, and it was okay.
Hopefully, the other spoons in the town will do a better job when I get there.

Now I’m a regular at spoons all over the place drink spot on food as always iffy but what Wigan had an abundance of was crackheads sat in the outside area swearing and abusing staff who to be fair strongly told them to leave. Hard to see a town I love being overrun with drug addicts it’s like day of the living dead so very sad .

I have been going to wetherspoons in greater Manchester, every one maybe most of them know about promotion offers, but not this one which is added in photos, student and plates low price etc. Then whenever you get food at most of them, you may have gone to weight watchers low potion chips.

Good value and great food.
They could use a few more staff behind the bar during the busy period.
Not to say the existing staff weren't very good.They were but it's unfair to put them under so much pressure all the time.
Come on, management.Give them a break.
Very nice location. Good value. Quick service as well.

Ordered 3 big breakfasts very disappointing. Looked lost on plate. Small spoonful of beans fatty bacon, presentation poor. Staff didn't even say good morning when we greeted them. Bit of a shame because last time we came here totally different feel  and food alot better.

Large sprawling town centre spoons, and even on a cold snowy Thursday morning, as busy as you'd expect. Plenty seating and a few nice nooks and corners to squirrel yourself away in.
Prices are obviously decent, staff are super lovely, the food though - not great, not good, and really borderline adequate.
On this particular day I ordered a deli wrap and paid extra for chips. Given the amount I was charged for the meal with extra chips, I was unhappy with the small portion of food.
And if that wasn't bad enough, food wasn't hot, didn't taste very good. Poor effort. I'd drink here sure, not eat.
Brill atmosphere in the moon, it is usually busy but the staff are on it and you get served. Can't beat wetherspoons prices.
Recommended Dishes: Pulled Pork Burrito, Onion Rings Steak and Chips, Mixed Grill Platter, Cheesy Garlic Bread

Review Text: Really gone down the drain lately. My last visit I ordered a burger that was rock hard and a mash and sausages which had 3 flies within the food. The quality of the reasurant has decreased rapidly over the last few months. Will not be coming back

Nice Wetherspoons, the decor is absolutely lovely, old stone and lots of character, somewhat big establishment, not huge but nice.

Obviously as you're used to the toilets are upstairs, staff are friendly and the foods standard for what you'd expect from a spoons.

Overall good experience.

Waited 45 minutes for breakfast. When we enquired at the bar about the food, we were told we were next in line. The food was then delivered 5 minutes later. The table next to us ordered a similar meal and the food was delivered within a few minutes. Obviously they had miss-placed our order but decided to cover up rather than own up.
Owning up, I could respect that.

Regarding the food it was pretty poor quality ingredients badly cooked, bland and tasteless.

Finally I hope the brown sauce shortage in Wigan gets resolved soon. Tomato ketchup everywhere but not a drop of brown to be found.
An older spec of wetherspoons but still well kept. Breakfast and drinks ordered on the app were delivered quickly and tasted great. Staff very friendly and polite.

A very cosy and nice pub in the middle of wigan. We where there on a stop over to manchester. The pub has a lush menu and both of our meals tasted good. thanks a lot to the team, helping us in any way.
Nice pub with good food and drink for quite a cheap price. A good load of vegetarian options as well. Could do with staff taking more notice of dirty tables though
Has some dodgy pointless set of stairs that look abar 100 years old and it's been put in C- in the gaff ratings

I called him after leaving the train from. Southport someone said try it so I did good food. Chicken wings spicy. Very spthe beer was OK, no stop were alright. Service was good and it was clean. So where are you won't try

40 minute wait for a breakfast on a Sunday morning for it to arrive cold.
Truthfully it’s not that nice neither it’s been microwaved.

This place as seriously gone down hill. I

f I could rate 0 stars I would.

Tables are left with plates on them & the place is just in a BIG mess.

Nicest part is the coffee, its from a machine but I must say this place isn’t clean or serve the food correctly I doubt the beers taste nice to and the lines aren’t cleaned regularly too.

It’s just down to poor management skills without experience to run a venue like this.

I will push this report through to your HQ as standards are seriously lacked. Sort it out!!

Always had great experiences with staff, even at the end of their long busy days.

Helpful, friendly and polite.

Amanda went above and beyond on my last visit, and I am very grateful.

10/10 would visit again.

Spitting feathers here got a game to watch. Sausage cold beans look like they’ve been cooked by my ancestors not good enough another minute goes by and me mouth is drier than the Sahara Desert and that’s hard to beat
Nice place, food good. Quick service. Nice little quiet corners to sit and be fairly private to eat and drink in the slightly up-stairs section.

Jeez. Who pissed on this crowds chips. They certainly didn't teach them anything about making,  or serving chips. Nor any other kind of food. Also worst punk I've ever had. Brewdog need to have a word

Building wise it's the whetherspoons answer to an M C Escher painting as  if you sit upstairs at the back of the restaurant, there's a staircase that goes nowhere so you have to go back downstairs to go back upstairs to visit the little boy's (or girl's) room. Being a town centre location it is usually quite busy in the afternoon but everything else such as the great value food and drinks, good menu selection and friendly staff are all still as you'd expect from this chain..

Spoons is spoons, not ever the place you really want to go but at the same time the place to go. Cheap and cheerful as you always expect from a spoons. Quick service had drinks within a couple of minutes.
A typical Spoons "in the town".  A small beer/smokers patio on a pedestrian way in central Wigan.  Good beer and basically everything as it should be.  Nice!

So after a drink night out in Manchester, I ended up coming to Wigan to support a friend. Thought u would grab breakfast in the weather spoons. Staff are very welcoming. The place is quite exceptional clean. And the breakfast is very good
A spacious spoons, with seating on multiple levels, the usual spoons fayre on offer. Busy but doesn't feel cramped.

Had a smashing meal at this place, not visited before but we'll be using it again. Nice pub atmosphere. Food was tasty, the beer was cold, place was very busy, the disabled toilets are downstairs. General toilets upstairs, steps to main dining area

Friendly staff. The food is good, but the menu rarely changes, so over time, the choice becomes boring.
Saying that, you can't complain about the price,
Recommended Dishes: Small English Breakfast, Fish and Chips

Review Text:
Sunday 2nd July 2023
Today I visited thisxwigan Weatherspoons

Very poor management and even worst service. Food and drinks always late cold and wrong. Not a good example of a weather-spoons

American breakfast was lovely except from the still frozen hash browns. They were replaced as soon as we noticed but had already put me off my food
We had a decent enough meal .Sat in the upstairs area with a dickensian feel.lovely big lanterns and nice brickwork give it a relaxed atmosphere.

As a person who has been in the premises in the past all I can say is excellent.
Staff 10 out of 10, polite and friendly and respectful.
Service was excellent.

Verbal abusive staff members.terrible service very poorly handled by management whom i will name emma Ford🙂,service totally disgusting what was once a good meeting place and pleasant place to eat is now far from that

I recently visited The Moon Under Water in Wigan and had an average experience. As a standard Wetherspoons, the restaurant had a typical layout and atmosphere. I ordered breakfast, which was alright, and the coffee was also okay. Overall, my visit was satisfactory, but I didn't find anything particularly outstanding about the restaurant. If you're looking for a reliable and affordable meal in the Wigan area, The Moon Under Water could be a decent option.
Typical day out in weatherpoons food was OK as the steak wasn't rare- medium but they done a new 1

We only paid for the car park and a coffee in the cafe.
There were trips on boats using the wheel, but we just walked around the area.

Great value for the money as all Wetherspoon pubs are. Enjoyed using their app for ordering food and drinks again. Will cut them some slack for all the dirty glasses and plates on so many tables as they were packed out probably due the pride parade taking place.

I'm a chef and I Don't serve raw pork, and when I do a mixed grill I make sure everything goes out of my kitchen is completely cooked even grillthe tomatoes, but what I didn't see is nobody came to ask how the meal is,  everywhere I go to eat the server's come over but not here Furthermore I will not be taking my wife there anymore.
Absolutely fantastic food, would highly recommend the 8oz steak. Asked for medium rare and it turned up cooked to perfection 😁
Recommended Dishes: Onion Rings Steak and Chips, Mixed Grill Platter, Fish and Chips

Review Text: Can't beat a weatherspoons breakie with a pint with a great atmosphere whatever time of day
Recommended Dishes: Small English Breakfast, Lasagne Served with Salad and Chips as Extra, Onion Rings Steak and Chips, Burger Small Portion Chips, Mixed Grill Platter, Fish and Chips, San Miguel

Cold  food

Bar Staff kept wife waiting at bar for ages not serving but they were serving others that just turned up to the bar.  She passed comment its been that long shall I go some were else? Good quality spoons good drinks good company staff were fine. Food was decent for the price. Perfect stop off before wigan warriors game
Very relaxing friendly staff delicious food with fair prices

Beautiful ambience.
A very cozy place to hang out with friends and chill.
Had a great time here with my friends last weekend.

I used to visit the moon under water on a regular basis. This last time however . The staff decided to make decisions on my ordered meal without talking to me . I never received my drink and also other items of the meal. When the staff asked me what I wanted to do about it I said I would like a full refund and gave the reason why. Walked out AGAIN 1st July,service very poor,staff look miserable,fed up,no enthusiasm, no system to serve in order,more interested in app orders than standing custom   VERRRYYY POOOR

Somewhere to go for cheap drinks, food and a good time. Can be a bit rough depending on which night your in but overall pretty decent place with plenty of seating and selection of drinks. With being a wetherpersons pub the table service app can be used which is brilliant and you can pay by your phone so you don't have to lug drinks up steep stairs or wait at the bar to order.
Wetherspoons. Need I say anymore. Typical beers and menu right in the town centre. Nothing remarkable but great value if you’re after some.
Friendly service , fast , breakfast was nice . Decent seating , a decent spoons.

The food on Monday evening was absolutely delicious! The staff were all friendly and made sure the food was amazing. Massive appreciation to Jorgi on the bar till, I am a fussy eater and some of the menu, they didn’t have in. She guided me to the best steak! My brother enjoyed his meal too!
Lovely  food today we had the mixed grill wasnice and hot and freshly made and the manger from the brocket was very helpful and friendly  keep up the great work a☆☆☆☆☆
I’ve got a game to watch here and been waiting nearly an hour for me breakie only wanted some sausage
The food is good  but I mean how can you go wrong with putting things in a microwave drinks are alright go here almost every Saturday for breakfast so 4 stars
Staff are friendly and helpful, just a shame that the customers are nothing but rude, arrogant old timers with nothing better to do with their lives than drink it away.
Recommended Dishes: Pulled Pork Burrito, Fish and Chips, Quorn Wrap with Extra Chips Paid Extra Chips Insult

Review Text: The barstaff are ignorant, we need new barstaff , 3 behind the bar and being ignored by the staff, the people beind the bar, are to woke. They needto change there attitude
Visited on a busy match day. Cheap prices and good staff. It's not the most attractive Wetherspoons but they have a larger range of cask ales than most. My pint was fantastic even in a plastic glass.
Just a drink on this visit. Served quickly, friendly barstaff, the pub was tidy and it was easy to get a seat.
Think they must have been short staffed. We struggled to find a clean table

Had freedom breakfast £3.99. Good value for money.  Tea brought to table but then told to visit the beverage corner for milk and sugar.  Not too clever on my feet so got my partner to bring over the jug of milk rather than carry my hot tea across the pub and upstairs to obtain milk! Disability awareness course could be needed!
Excellent pub very good atmosphere good food and drinks prices can recommend
I love it and they always welcome you anytime and they have lovley staff and always come around to you and check was your food okay and everything okay love going here
The Moon Under the Water us great value for money. Staff are very helpful: wonderful place.
It is a wonderful place to have drinks and food with family and friends.
Can you ever rate spoons 5? Service and food was as expected, great, few family feuds and drunks ruined the experience. Or did they make it ;)

Food is adequate for breakfast or lunch, however there seems to always be only one person taking orders at the bar even during breakfast and lunch rush. The all you can drink beverages are a good idea, however they only provide sugar to flavour your coffee, expresso, and lattes.....
Only drawback is the number of steps, simple things like going  to the toilet are difficult to someone with reduced mobility
Decent pint. Good price.
Well placed and we were lucky to have the weather to sit outside

Nice Spoons in comparison to many, the atmosphere and ambience at the front of the bar was less to be desired however this contrasted with the much more relaxing back of the bar upstairs which was a lot nicer. After requesting salt I was told by the first waiter to go downstairs and get it. Even whilst they were coming back up again to deliver some more of our food but the other female waiter was a lot more pleasant and got us some instead. The food and drink were what you'd expect from a spoons.
Excellent bar and friendly staff and the food is good and quite reasonable
A good example of a Wetherspoons pub. Lovely building decent beer,food and service.
Rami bouncer absolutely amazing good service!! 10/10

My 1st time in here. Even though alone. I didn't feel uncomfortable. Ordered the Vegan Beyond Burger. And doubled up. As was quite hungry. Absolutely delicious. The bread roll they were served in. Remained soft. No grease from burgers. Chips were also tasty really smooth potato.

Well, where do I start!!!
If you want entertainment without the cost of admission then this place offers it all from local drunks fighting over pence on the bar to desert being offered that’s not on the menu.
This establishment is one of the worst JD Wetherspoon’s I have unfortunately found myself in.
Late night food should 100% come with a “chef may not give a shit” warning.
I have seen my 4 year old niece microwave and plate up a meal with better results.

I have noticed that this chain as gone down hill over the years but this one has hit an all time new record of low quality.
I am in fact leaving this place after twice sending my meal back to settle for a kebab shop that put me in hospital in 2013 with food poisoning as at least that was seasoned correctly.
Breakfast was cold and plates were freezing too ... very disappointed.

Meal very good and plenty
On plate excellent 👌 …

Wigan, I mean what can I say apart from it has Wigan people in it. (By the way love Wigan people) this pub is great it's full of character it's always busy and not a place I cam complian about. It's my Friday place

Cheap beer & food.
Poor service (under staffed), tables not cleaned, the food is like fast food.

Customer service non-existent. The bar staff dropped the metal measure in the glass and fished it out with fingers then served the drink while laughing about it with other customers. Put full sugar coke in a drink instead of diet coke. No please or thank you when asking for money or giving change, or basic manners of any kind.

We were in here on "Pride" weekend so it was really busy.... could have had more staff on as the tables needed clearing all over the pub. We ordered food and drinks on their "app" and all arrived promptly. Would have given 5 stars but for the dirty tables.

We love the moon for aquick Sunday morning breakfast. We sit in the upstairs area so it's not like being in a noisy pub which is nice. As a family of 4 we always enjoy this wallet friendly treat, the options are great as there is something for everyone.

Met with friends for a college reunion yesterday. Very impressed with the service. Ordered food at the bar and waited less than fifteen minutes before it was brought to the tables promptly and piping hot. Excellent service from the staff also.
Didn't enjoy the food at all, not cheap either wouldn't go again
Can't beat a Spoons breakfast on a Sunday morning. Great value, fast service and the lavazza coffee is pretty decent as well.

The coffee machines are often left empty for extended periods of time, even notifying staff doesn't help as you get fobbed off with "someone will sort it soon" was there for an hour and managed to have a black coffee with the milk from the jug.

Went here for breakfast with my boyfriend, ordered a vegetarian breakfast for myself and he had a large breakfast (containing meat). Even after addressing to the guy who was serving us that the vegetarian breakfast is for myself, he still gave me the wrong one and was under the impression they were both the same he gave me the wrong one whilst the veg breakfast was still contaminated. Won’t be going here again, service was awful, food was really below usual standard, it’s a no from me.
Ordered the full English, arrived promptly, and perfectly cooked too!

It's at the rougher end of Wetherspoons establishments. Nice building, toilets upstairs (common for 'spoons!), pleasant raised area to the rear. Good, long bar.

But you may see the odd fight break out 😀

Pretty good Wetherspoons.  Real ale on form, service good,  plenty of space, lovely chicken wings, good atmosphere. Odd combination of lower priced drinks and more expensive food, especially given the out of city location, but still better and a bargain compared with anywhere else in Wigan town centre.

A pleasant visit. Prices of food and drink good, still offer table service and staff were happy to accommodate getting a glass if ice or topping drinks up with more mixer, when asked

I like the fact that the screens are still in place gives it a feeling of privacy between the tables.

I had a burger and chips and some onion rings which tasted lovely
It's a typical witherspoons food ok staff always nice
Cheap food and not bad they normally do a good breakfast and refillable hot drinks cant grumble really wouldnt go if i wanted a nice tea out  , would just go for cheap grub
Local spoons innit, what more can you want! Love this place!
Went in for beer & food.Quiet for a Thursday but beer OK as was the Jalfezie curry. Onion barges were not warmed up correctly so complained & they were replaced.
Standard Wetherspoons pub with usual facilities. Beer choices have gone a bit downhill in Spoons pubs post Covid and this one is no different. Use the Wetherspoons app to see what Real Ales are on.
Lovely place but hot drinks machines did not have the full choice available. No mocha or hot chocolate. Very disappointing
Great service and fast food too. Shame beans were cold and Tomato's removed from the menu but hey ho
A truly nice place to come to, warm, food is deliver in good time, lovely staff.

Ordered 2 Hot and Spicy chicken meals and got 2 Lemon chicken meals with spicy sauce instead. I'm not fussed when it comes to chicken myself what flavor it is however my Dad isn't a lover of lemon.
The picture on the menu showed a red marinated (hot and spicy) chicken and a yellow marinated (lemon) chicken.
My Dad had to get a refund, the staff were saying that both hot and spicy and lemon chicken are both lemon flavoured which doesn't make sense as they clearly a different colour on the menu.

Not the best, waited half an hour this morning for breakfast and by the time it was served it was barely even luke warm.  Its never what you'd call gourmet food, you get what you pay for but today was worse than usual

Can't complain, especially considering the price. Went for breakfast and sat in the corner near the Wiend entrance and it's a nice, cozy corner of the pub. Less thank £30 for 4 breakfasts, hot drinks and orange juice all round. Service was quick and the breakfast filled a hole!

Stopped off for breakfast after an active morning.  Very surprised by the standard of the breakfast as the food was at a good temp and seemed that care had gone in to the preparation, very pleased.  Good customer service and practicing social distancing and mask wearing.

If you want to go and have a meal and a drink where a lot of the punters can't string a sentence together without f'ing and blinding, then this is the place for you! The Brocket is much better.
August 2022 - Went for breakfast and had a bacon & egg butty and a coffee - delicious.  All the staff were really helpful and friendly.  Much improved on my previous visit!

Good branch of Wetherspoons and the back section is truly unique in a diagon ally kinda way. That said not had any salt for a few weeks now and can feel a little dirty as tables not always cleaned. Also a fair wait for food, but still well worth a visit!
Typical wethersppons . Good friendly staff . Good variety of drinks . A popular pub   but still found some empty clean tables xx
A great town centre alehouse, with all the amenities you would expect - great ale, food and ambiance - in a well- established Wetherspoons pub. My personal loyalty is beyond question!

It's very hit and miss on the food at this weatherspoons sadly they seem under staffed with the influx of people who come here to get paralyticly drunk. On a good day it is brilliant. It's the customers who normally let it down.

Lovely place with good company and an average price for Threater drinks,
you can also get hot food and snacks here
We watch Rose with Maureen Lipman very good performance.
Free Parking and easy to find
It's cheap and cheerful and the food ain't bad
Potions have gone alot smaller and not worth the price.
Good food n beer and friendly service always worth a visit

Food was lovely. Ordered on the app but the food came before the drinks which was disappointing. Also had to ask for table to be wiped down. However it was busy and the staff were really friendly and helpful
Loads of seating, food was delicious and we were appropriately ID'd in a friendly fashion. Can't wait to go again!

Poor, in fact very poor service, I went to St Helens one (Glass House) lot busier, served quickly. Some good staff in Wigan, generally new starts, disgusting,  me and Fri have walked out several times, especially when lazy bones are on.

Love this pub. It's just a mess all the time, not enough staff to clear glasses and plates. Very difficult to find a table available. But I absolutely love the vegetarian menu!! Thank you so much that makes life so much easier :) great prices as well. Noodle stir fry is very tasty, side of fries also good but way too big!
Staff need to put a smile on there faces and stop telling customers to basicly hurry up when ordering there stuff and making you feel uncomfortable

If you love a Wetherspoons then this is a safe option, plenty seating and not too hot in the summer due to the AC, however, if you like it cold i hope that also applies to your food. I ordered three mini plates for 12 quid and to be fair the portions were rather big but they were very cold which ruined my fries but the nachos were still good.

Pros;
Nice and cool in the summer
Good location near the train stations and bus station
Large so plenty seating
Very fast drink service

Cons;
Cold food
No televisions for the Euros
The cutlery they gave me was filthy like theres no way it had even seen a sink

All in all I'd go as pit stop for a few decent drinks then move down towards king street for the atmosphere or up to the local John Bull Chophouse if you like your rock music and ale.

3/5 Because it really is worth popping in or meeting the squad there but anything more than a few swift drinks and the cracks soon appear.

As a spoons it's quiet nice, service and problems are quickly solved however when it's busy you're best off ordering 2 or 3 drinks at a time as it can take a while to turn up to the table which is understandable due to the world the way it is and the table are kept clean.

I would recommend going here for pre drinks or if you're on a day out with mates go here for a cool pint it won't drain your bank.

Yes, the seats come apart. Yes, the place stinks of stale ale. Yes, you will go on a quest to reach the toilets.

Will it matter when your bill for drinks and food will come to 2p when you leave? Exactly. 👍
The moons always a goto for a bit of lunch. Normal spoons food and good ales. Staff were not the most helpful though which is a shame.
The steak was bleeding  long wait for drinks and food
A standard Wetherspoons except the service was atrocious, but they later put signs up saying they were understaffed. Waited ages for cutlery while our food went cold.
Great food and drinks cheaper than cooking at home

Always enjoy a pitstop here excellent value for money just one thing I ordered a portion of cheese on my jacket potato and it was left off but as soon as I told the girl that served me it was rectified straight away

Pasta alfredo portion was worth laughing at.
One of the witresses wasnt too friendly (no hello, no thank you no nothing really).

Besides that the food was tasty

Food was good, waitress service excellent ..... no clean tables when we arrived and 2 door staff having a row at the front door when we got there ..... we had my 3 year old grandaughter with us and it upset her. Girly lunch ruined by neanderthals
Typical Wetherspoons cheap and cheerful

Great that it does table service via the app.  Didn't have to queue at the bar to order food or drinks. Food was value for money and you could add extras to the meals. The only downside was that the waitress plonked the food on the table and didn't even ask if we needed any condiments which aren't provided already at the table. It was just the lack of pleasant service that let you down.

Not one of the good experiences at Wetherspoons this morning, ordered breakfast and drinks at 11am. Took 20mins for the drink to arrive followed by another 20mins for the breakfast. When breakfast came in was cold, if it wasn't that we were hungry would have been saying something. Porridge for one of the kids were bought woth a folk and not a spoon. Cant even say it was a big order was only x2 adult breakfast and x2 things for the kids. Wont be rushing back again in a hurry.

Nice food with pleasant interior.
I had scampi and chips with a diet coke.
Centre of Wigan nice atmosphere..nothing is to much for the staff..& very reasonable..& food..coffee & Tea ..my drink ..cheers & All the best for 23 x

Usually love spoons but this was not too great I can't lie. The drinks are always good but the food is always the main disappointment and unfortunately me and my partner always come there for that reason. The first Instance was back in May this year  when they messed up a dessert of mine thinking I was having mini pancakes rather than none. I shown them my receipt and said they'll make me some more as a result, I had the two mini pancakes with sauce then brought the others with no sauce, which annoyed me. The second time the food was just extremely dry and my partners was burnt. I recommend going the Brocket personally,  trust me it is worth the slightly longer journey.

Three of us dined in. Beer was good, the meals were very tasty and the staff were extremely helpful and capable. The Covid restrictions do make serving customers much more difficult than pre-covid but the staff coped admirably well. We shall gladly return next month.

It was ok. Extremely busy and it was obvious they were short staffed. Food is nice, you always get a good meal in wetherspoons. Staff polite and helpful when you could catch them. Waited over 40 minutes for our main meal. Also, didnt have in stock what i wanted initially. They have fabulous toilets though and in good condition.
Always get a nice meal ther what ever we choose its cheap and cheerful, staff are always manerly as well. No complaints at all 👍xxx …
Good atmosphere, good breakfast

We came today for fish Friday. I ordered from my phone a 175 Merlot. When I looked at it I could see it was well below the 175 mark. The food arrived a couple of minutes later and I told the assistant. She said I'll get it changed. She brought it back and put it on the table without any comment.

I got the impression she thought I'd already drank some of it. Her lack of any response, apologetic or otherwise led me to think this.

No-one asked what our food was like. I'm sorry to say it wasn't as good as usual. The fish did not taste fresh.

We've been many times and it is usually good, and I've never been given wrong measure of wine before.

One of my favourite pubs in Wigan. Great for watching sport but they have a constant problem with service, not the staffs fault but the management. Never seem to have sufficient staff behind the bar when you would expect them. Other than this a good tidy pub.
Great service and food, although the pizzas could be better. I've worked in hospitality and it takes 2 seconds to use a pizza cutter and cut a pizza, instead of sending it out with a knife and fork
Great place as always. Been a few years since I was last in, but still no music and just a good place to have a drink. Nice to know you don’t need gimmicks all the time.

Excellent Wetherspoons Pub on 2 levels close to Market Place. Cosy atmosphere if a little noisy and crowded on Friday and Saturday Evenings. Mornings and Lunchtime very comfortable and quiet by comparison. Had Fish n Chips Friday (Delicious) and large and small Breakfasts (available 8-12am with Beer from 9am) Saturday and Sunday. Very good quality.  Substantial Sunday Brunch also available. Beers varied, well kept and good, price.  Service excellent, toilets clean. Locals friendly. Really liked the references to local history in the pub (George Orwell, Wigan Casino, Pier, Coal Mining etc), pictures  and other nice touches like tourist information and paintings by local artists.
